episodes.natural_language:
Case: Curtis-Lee-Justice-MVA-2-5-2023. Client: Curtis Lee Justice.

In early June 2023, correspondence related to Curtis Justice’s motor vehicle accident claim was circulated between the Whaley Law Firm and Clearcover. The matter is associated with Clearcover claim number 23ATKY338083287 and policy KY165502, with the date of loss reported as February 5, 2023. The subject line referenced was “Re: FW: Clearcover 23ATKY338083287, CURTIS JUSTICE.” Justin Chumbley of Whaley Law Firm reassigned the file, and Coleen Thea Ferry Madayag of Whaley Law Firm acknowledged the reassignment with the note, “This is noted.”

On June 1, 2023, Clearcover’s claims representative, Yaneth Hernandez, wrote to Justin’s firm and introduced herself as the handler for Curtis Justice’s claim, indicating she would work to resolve it promptly. She asked to know whether the office would be representing Mr. Justice for property damage or if discussions could proceed directly with him. Hernandez noted that Mr. Justice had planned to send photos for the vehicle estimate during a phone call on March 27, but those photos had not yet been received. The email listed the following claim details: Policy Number KY165502; Your Claim Number 23ATKY338083287; Date of Loss February 5, 2023; Hernandez’s phone number 312-235-1048. She also referenced claimsteam@claims.clearcover.com and included a message from Clearcover to Whaley Law Firm.

Hernandez stated that Clearcover had received a letter of representation dated March 30, 2023, and outlined the information needed to properly evaluate the claim. The email indicated that attachments included CMS, HIPAA, and a Medical Provider List, and requested that Mr. Justice complete these forms and return them as soon as possible. For evaluation purposes, Clearcover requested the following documentation: all medical records relating to treatment since the accident; if any pre-existing conditions relate to injuries sustained in the loss, prior records will be required; and if Mr. Justice claims any wage loss resulting from the accident, proper supporting documentation is required. The message concluded with appreciation for anticipated cooperation, and provided contact details: claims@clearcover.com and 312-235-1048.

On June 15, 2023, Coleen Thea Ferry Madayag of the Whaley Law Firm sent a message with the subject 755905 to the fax address 6158466265@rcfax.com. She requested Trexis acknowledge receipt of the law firm’s letter of representation and to forward an updated PIP ledger for their client, Curtis Justice. The body of that message included a confidentiality notice stating that the information was confidential and intended only for the named recipient, with instructions to contact the sender and destroy copies if the reader was not the intended recipient; it also contained a disclaimer about virus responsibility and Trexis Insurance’s lack of liability for any loss or damage arising from its use.

On June 21, 2023, at 3:41 PM, Coleen again wrote to Ms. Torian, explaining that she hoped the email found her well and reiterating the request to acknowledge the letter of representation and to send the updated PIP ledger for Curtis Justice. In the Curtis Lee Justice motor vehicle accident case (MVA) dated 2-5-2023, an issue arose around a RESCAN of billing records. The Whaley Law Firm, through attorney Jessica, initiated a request to obtain the client’s billing invoices. On June 7, 2023, a RESCAN request was sent from smartrequest@cioxhealth.com to the escalation system (srescalations) on behalf of Jessica. The message logged the following details: Date of request 6/6/2023; Customer Number 2254128; Invoice Number/E-request ID 149009539; Name of Contact Jessica; Contact Info 502-583-4022; Email jessica@whaleylawfirm.com. The chat details note: Request ID 149009539 – we received medical records but also need billing. If you could send that to rescan that’d be great! Employee Initials: S.T. The message also indicates it was sent through Ciox Health’s Smart Request system and, in line with the footer, carried the note that “This message was secured by Zix.”

The following day, June 8, 2023 at 8:11 AM, SREscalations replied to Jessica. In a message titled RE:418005338, Jasmine S apologized that not all items had been released as originally requested. She stated that she had submitted a rescan for the missing bills and asked Jessica to allow 7 to 10 days for completion.

Nearly a month later, on August 7, 2023 at 10:54:55 AM, Jessica again contacted SREscalations with the subject RE: RESCAN. She reported that they had never received the bills as requested and urged that they be sent as soon as possible. This August 7 email was sent from The Whaley Law Firm to SREscalations, with the Request ID 149009539 noted in the header, and cc’d CurtisLeeJusticeMVAZ3541225@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com. The message was brief, stating simply that the bills had not been received and requesting prompt sending.

episodes.natural_language:
Case Curtis-Lee-Justice-MVA-2-5-2023 involves client Curtis Lee Justice. On September 11, 2024, Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm spoke with the client regarding the motor vehicle accident case. The client stated that he has never been paid for PD, explaining that the car was totaled and that he was supposed to receive $4,700 for PD, but that payment never arrived. He asked for a follow-up.

The client also stated that he did not owe any money on the truck. The communication was sent from Aaron Whaley to Justin Chumbley and Curtis Lee Justice, and Whaley Law Firm’s signature includes the firm’s contact details: 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, 502-583-4022.
